lexUnit.name: lie down.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: assume a horizontal position on a supporting surface

sentence.text: Then again the most beleaguered hostess would not swap a cantankerous granny on a Poundstretcher for a panicking mare trying to lie down in her stall at 30,000 feet .
` Luke will , " Anna said unfairly , turning away and looking at her beautifully dug earth , and thinking how much she would just like to lie down on it and sleep .
Norma , 55 , was unable to lie down for three months while her neck healed after a fall downstairs at a friend 's house .
After the ambulance men had removed the body , Jean resisted the impulse to go home , lie down on her bed and cry .
` They just used to crawl around in swamps and stuff , and all they breathed was stink , " said Hrun , lying down in the bunk .
The demonstrators were prepared to lie down in front of trucks carrying concrete for the foundations of the mast , at Cairn Papple , near Bathgate , in West Lothian .
` Lie down , my dear girl , " Tremayne said .
When he had vanished from sight she expelled a long sigh and allowed the mask to slip away from her face , slowing returning to her towel and lying down flat on it .
The big monster lay down next to me with its fur against my skin .
Piers lay down flat on his towel , pulling an old cap over his eyes .
They also lay down beside him and pressed their bodies against his to heat him .
So having made his way back to the hotel he closed the shutters , took off his shoes , jacket and tie , lay down on the bed and cast off .
It seems that when they were made to lie down in the back of the truck and their hands were tied behind them , Katrine remembers there being rags underneath her .
Taff lay down on his back on the floor of the trench , oblivious to the mosquitoes and everything else and was soon snoring loudly .
Helen and I climbed into Anerley Park and lay down on our backs on the grass by the swings , and looked at the sky , and pulled our clothes down .
` We have to lie down on our backs .
Some people expect to see a Sigmund Freud-like figure and to lie down on a couch .
I lie down on the bench and try and make myself comfy .
With his hands still covered in paint he lay down on the chilly sheets and waited for sleep to take his confusions away .
Your partner should be lying down on his or her back with a cushion or rolled up towel under the knees to prevent any strain in the lumbar region .

Their udders dropped and their teats became larger and more pendulous so that when they lay down in their stalls the vital milk-producing organ was pushed away to one side into the path of the neighbouring animals .
` He means the hare decided to lie down in the middle of the field instead of running , " he explained .
Then she lay down in the water and let the scented heat wash over her .
In absolute terror , I lay down beside him .
One hot night he came home drunk and lay down on the flower-bed in the garden just outside the studio and fell fast asleep .
She lay down silently , pulling the covers over herself to get warm .
After a couple of hours , Zeno had simply lain down on the floor and gone to sleep .
